title: A Career Criminal and a Joke Justice System
sub_head: Prosecutors’ focus must return to protecting victims by keeping the people who prey on them in prison.
body:
When 118 people are responsible for more than 2,400 crimes (“Shoplifting as Usual in Seattle,” Review & Outlook, May 6), they are professional criminals. Their day job is larceny. And who knows how many crimes they committed for which they weren’t caught? The increase in crime won’t abate until the focus returns to protecting victims by keeping the people who prey on them in prison.
Albert Teichman
